thread.title: Michelle Heaton's drinking session ends in tears in NZ
thread.title_full: Michelle Heaton's drinking session ends in tears in NZ | Daily Mail Online

author: Ryan Smith
title: Michelle Heaton's drinking session ends in tears in NZ
text:
The members of Atomic Kitten been enjoying something of a career revival, as they hit the road on a tour throughout New Zealand and Australia.
But Michelle Heaton, 37, may need to learn to pace herself, after a recent day of drinking on Auckland's Waiheke island left her violently vomiting and shedding tears.
In photographs exclusively obtained by MailOnline, the singer - accompanied by bandmates Kerry Katona, 36, and Natasha Hamilton, 34 - is seen stopping in a car on the side of the road to deposit the liquefied expulsion after a wine-drinking session.
Scroll down for video
Wine and whine: Michelle Heaton, 37, was seen looking a little worse for wear after drinking wine on Waiheke island, in Auckland, New Zealand, recently
A worried Natasha is seen rushing to the open passenger door to the aid of Michelle, whose brunette tresses have been tied up, in a bid to avoid a messier situation.
And on making it back to her hotel, a tearful Michelle is seen being helped by the band's burly tour manager as she clutches her chest and carries a bundle of tissues.
Wearing a striped blue-and-white playsuit with flip-flops, things had started on a much lighter note for brunette Michelle, who has stepped in on the tour in place of Liz McClarnon.
Ouch: The singer was seen throwing up on the side of the road soon after the drinking session
Deposit: The British singer's liquefied expulsion was left on the roadside for all to see
Just the three of us: She was seen soon after her drinking session with her Atomic Kitten bandmates (l-r) Kerry Katona, 36, and Natasha Hamilton, 34
Spirited: They were engaged in what appeared to be a highly spirited conversation
Copy Kerry in a pair of crochet trim shorts Kerry's shorts
Shop similar below!
Whilst it may be pretty chilly over in Blighty, the Atomic Kitten band mates are enjoying the sunny climes of New Zealand where it's the middle of summer!
Kerry Katona was taking full advantage of the warm weather showing off her pins in a pair on monochrome crochet trim shorts and a white tank top. The songstress then accessorised her look with a straw fedora hat and pink flip flops.
We're loving these cute shorts on Kerry, the crochet trim gives them a boho feel; meanwhile the monochrome colourway keeps them chic!
If you're jetting off somewhere sunny soon, these shorts are the perfect suitcase staple so take your pick from our edit of similar styles in the carousel below
* PRICES MAY NOT BE AS ADVERTISED ...NOW GET SOME SHORTS LIKE KERRY'S £38 Hedonia Alana Lace Trim Shorts at ASOS (reduced to £9)
Buy now
£16 Boohoo Polly Crochet Trim Co-ord (reduced to £8)
Buy now
£22 ASOS Lace Trim Satin Shorts
Buy now
£25 Topshop Floral Crochet Shorts
Buy now
Dropped: They scrambled on the floor for a dropped item as their drinking session ended
Happy girls: Dressed in a striped playsuit, Michelle appeared to be in jovial spirits on the day
We're having a laugh! They were seen getting rowdy as they hung out together in the sunshine
Eyewitnesses tell MailOnline that the trio made the most of their downtime between shows by enjoying a day of drinking wine in the balmy sunshine.
Clad in a white sleeveless top with black shorts and a cream wide-brimmed hat, Kerry appeared to be in her element as she hung out with her bandmates.
Natasha, wearing a patterned mini-dress with a black hat and black sandals, also looked to be in jovial spirits before things went woefully awry for Michelle.
Sickly: However, things took a turn for the worst, as it appeared the drink didn't agree with her
Helping hand: Natasha quickly came to her bandmate's aid, helping her as nausea took a grip
This is how we roll: Traffic drove around the girls as they worked through their mini crisis
Far from heaven scent! Natasha was seen covering her nose as the stench became too much
Moving: After stopping in the middle of the road, the singers were driven on to their hotel
But it appears that Michelle has been left undeterred by the incident, as she shared a shot of herself enjoying a martini on Monday.
She captioned the sun-drenched shot: 'Early evening dinner watching the sun set here in Perth... early night ready for your gig 2moz xxx (sic).'
Accompanied by B*Witched, East 17 and S Club 3, Atomic Kitten are due to play their next show at Perth's Metro City on Tuesday.
Earlier on Monday, Kerry showed off her voluptuous figure in a midnight blue bikini as she hit the beach.
Team effort: The stars - and their tour manager - helped her out of the car at their hotel
Unsteady: Michelle appeared to be on unsteady feet as she emerged from the car
Take my hand: Kerry supported Michelle, who appeared to need all the help she could get
Not the day she'd planned: The brunette clutched her chest as she was helped home
Words: She appeared to be getting words of reassurance during the slow and careful walk
Casual: Natasha later threw a leather jacket over her ensemble as the sweltering sun set
Bag lady: Natasha and Kerry carried extra baggage as they made their way back to the hotel
'Woohoo loving the beach,' she wrote alongside the snapshot which she posted on Twitter .
The 36-year-old mother of five, who underwent a mini-tummy tuck and liposuction last year, also used her social media account to hit back at claims she and Atomic Kitten bandmate Natasha have been feuding.
'Where the hell this spat between tash and me has come from god knows @NatashaOfficial we’re like bloody sisters!! Xxx' she wrote.
Swing out sister: Michelle's session looked to have an effect as she got hands-on with her pals
Sad face: Kerry playfully pulled faces at Michelle as they stood outside the drinking venue
Wipe: Michelle held a tissue to Kerry's face and both she and Natasha turned their heads away
Huff and puff: Kerry enjoyed a cigarette as she stood on the roadside with her bandmates
Back in the game: They have been enjoying something of a resurgence in popularity with their current tour of Australia and New Zealand
Yesteryear: Among the bands of yesteryear touring with them are B*Witched and East 17
When 7 become 3: Also on the bill are a greatly reduced S Club 3, formerly known as S Club 7
Fear: Atomic Kitten member Liz McClarnon didn't join the tour due to her fear of flying
Stepping into her shoes: Michelle stepped into Liz's shoes after she pulled out of the tour
The Daily Mirror had previously reported there had been 'awkward tension' between the pair as they performed their biggest hits during their set in New Zealand on Saturday.
The drama centred around whether their chart-topping song Whole Again counted as Kerry's number one - seeing as she had left the band shortly after the single's release.
As the group finished singing Whole Again, Kerry allegedly said: 'I was in the band then! So it's my number one too!'
'It's everyone's number one,' Natasha is said to have replied.
Learned her lesson? On Monday evening, Michelle shared a shot of herself enjoying a martini
Strike a pose: The ladies posed together in the sunshine as they prepared for their next show
Oh, I do like to be beside the seaside: She gushed about her breathtaking view of the ocean
Chilling out: Natasha also took to Instagram to share a shot from her 'chilled evening'
Loving the beach! Earlier in the day, Kerry showed off her voluptuous figure in a new Twitter snapshot in a break from the Atomic Kitten reunion tour
Awkward: It was reported old feuds may have been reignited with Natasha Hamilton and Kerry during their Atomic Kitten reunion concert in New Zealand on Saturday
A source denied the claims, telling MailOnline: 'There's no truth in that at all - look at the girls' social media. They are loving every second of it.
'The only negative is Natasha away from her family, which she hates. But like other working families, it's part and parcel of what she has to do.'
It comes after Kerry declared that she was the founding member of Atomic Kitten, and insisted her replacement Jenny Frost got the 'opportunity of a lifetime' when she took over from her.
Sizzling: Kerry posted several pictures of herself with a snake, claiming it was like 'being back in the jungle again'
Reptile time: The star didn't seem too bothered about her encounter with her slithery friend
Speaking in her OK! column in 2012, Quote: : 'The thing is, I was the founding member and for two months I was on my own during auditions when we first chose Liz McClarnon and Heidi Range, then when Heidi left we all chose Natasha Hamilton.
'When I left, the band went on to become bigger and better and I watched on with great pride. I'm not going to get into a slanging match over the Kittens.
'But Jenny got the opportunity of a lifetime when she took over from me, they were number one when she joined the band but it was my voice on the record.'
Oh dear: According to the Daily Mirror, there was 'awkward tension' between the pair as they performed their biggest hits during the set (pictured in 1999)
Tension? The drama centred around whether their chart-topping song Whole Again counted as Kerry's number one - seeing as she had left the band shortly after the single's release (pictured in 2000)
And it seems her comments riled the other Kittens, with a source telling The Mirror that Natasha was 'p*ssed off'.
The insider claimed that Liz McLarnon and Kerry were both in the band when Natasha was chosen by bosses after impressing them with her strong voice.
'Kerry took an instant disliking to her,' they said. 'Kerry didn't want Tash in the band. It was Liz who wanted her because they needed someone who could sing.
'Management told Kerry to "put up or shut up". Natasha and Liz have held their tongues until now, keeping a dignified silence. But feathers are being well and truly ruffled.'
Eek: It comes as Kerry declared that she was the founding member of Atomic Kitten, and insisted her replacement Jenny Frost got the 'opportunity of a lifetime' when she took over from her
Opinionated: Kerry said in 2012: 'Jenny got the opportunity of a lifetime when she took over from me, they were number one when she joined the band but it was my voice on the record'
Meanwhile, due to Liz McClarnon's major fear of flying, the band was forced to ask Liberty X star Michelle Heaton to step in.
Michelle said: 'I've joined long-term but only internationally because Liz hates flying.
'Kerry and Natasha are a bit more wild than I'm used to in Liberty X but I'm crazy too, so it's perfect.'
Talking to the Daily Star, she added: 'We're all mums so when we're away we let our hair down.'
Not whole again: Due to Liz McClarnon's major fear of flying, the band was forced to ask Liberty X star Michelle Heaton to step in
Having a whale of a time! The threesome appeared to be in great spirits after the gig
